name: Hopscotch Canyon
description:
Introduction

The reef in the Northern Swell forms short, east-facing, wide canyons with potholes.

Individually these canyons aren't headliners, but together they can make a fun practice destination and several can be descended in a day.

Hopscotch is named for the giant H formed by fault lines in the satellite view and it's downclimbing, non-technical nature.

Getting There

Drive to TH:

Option 1: From the exit on I-70 for Highway 24, head north on County Rd 1029 (S. Four Corners Mine Rd) up Buckmaster Draw for 4.8 miles. After a curve to the east, continue north on CR 1032 (South Buckmaster Rd) for 2.4 miles to the Junction of South Buckmaster Rd, North Buckmaster Rd and Smith Camp Rd.

Option 2: From I-70, drive north on US Hwy 6/191 for 4.7 miles and exit West onto County Road 1080 (Smith Camp/North Buckmaster Rd) for 2.25 miles to the same Junction.

From the Junction, drive north on CR 1030 (Smith Camp Rd) for 4.3 miles to the junction with Smith Cabin Tidwell Draw Rd and Cottonwood Wash.

Hopscotch Canyon is 1.3 miles south on Smith Cabin Tidwell Draw Rd. The road is good for the first 0.9 miles, then gets a little rougher, probably requiring 4WD/HC for the next 0.4 miles.

Turn off to the west at a vertical signpost indicated a dead end spur to park 0.5 miles from Smith Cabin Tidwell Draw Rd. This spur is the roughest and requires 4WD/HC.

Approach

On Foot:

Walk the short downhill to the drainage and proceed upstream on a trail on the right of the trees in the drainage next to some rocky overhangs (Right Up Canyon). Gain a dirt ridge at the confluence. Hopscotch is the canyon on the right. Looking Left Up Canyon, note a large pour off that might make for a singular rappel of 100' or more.

Upclimb in a drainage on the right of the pour off. Trend right (North) when possible toward the end of the drainage and walk around domes to the Northeast and downhill again.

Descent

Hike/Scramble down the drainage.

Bypass two potholes on Canyon Right.

Exit

At the confluence, retrace the approach back to the car.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

14May2022: Ira Lewis, Dan Kinler, Eva Vaitkus

properties.name: Smith Camp Rd / N Buckmaster Rd
